I am currently a Master‚Äôs student in Software Engineering at the University of Melbourne (Unimelb), Australia. I‚Äôm interested in process-aware data science, computer modelling and machine learning.

My current research focuses on developing advanced algorithms for approximate conformance checking between process execution data and models[read more].

I‚Äôm also involved in Foragecaster, a project that aims at developing an AI-powered planner system to support farmers‚Äô decisions on forage, grazing livestock, and farm sustainability. I lead the research on data quality and explainability, where we develop systematic framework and methods to evaluate key farm production data, diagnose and repair potential data quality issues, and investigate their root causes to improve future data management and ensure effective use of machine learning models from a data-centric perspective.
